verses.verse: Am I not a missionary? Am I not free? Have I not seen Jesus, the Anointed King, our Master? Are you not my work in the Master?
If I am not a missionary to others, still I definitely am to you. You see, you (in the Master) are the seal of my mission.
My defense to the people investigating me is this.
Do we not in any way have authority to eat and drink?
Don't we in any way have authority to be leading around a sister, a wife, even as the rest of the missionaries, the brothers of the Master, and Cephas (Aramaic for Peter)?
Or do only I and Barnabas not have authority of the "to not be working" kind?
Who serves in the military at any time paying his own wages? Who plants a vineyard and doesn't eat from its fruit? Or who shepherds a flock and doesn't eat from the milk of the flock?
I am not speaking these things in line with a person, am I? Or doesn't the law also say these things?
You see, it has been written in Moses' law, (in Deuteronomy 25:4) "You won't muzzle a cow processing grain." God doesn't care for the cows, does He?

Or does He say it by all means because of us? You see, because of us, it was written, because the person plowing is obligated to be plowing based on anticipation and the person processing grain to be taking part in his anticipation based on anticipation.
If we seeded the spiritual things in you, is it a huge thing if we will harvest your physical things?

If others take part in your authority, shouldn't we more? But we don't use this authority. No, we put up with all things so that we might not give any interruption to the good news of the Anointed King.
Don't you realize that the people working with the temple things eat from the temple grounds? The people attending to the altar receive an allotment to the altar.
This is also how the Master specifically arranged it for the people proclaiming the good news: for them to be living from the good news.

But I have used none of these things. I didn't write these things so that it might become like this in me. You see, it is nice for me instead to die, than that someone would make my bragging meaningless.
You see, if I share good news, to me it isn't something to brag about; for an obligation is lying on me. What a tragedy it is to me if I don't share good news;
for if I constantly do this thing voluntarily, I get pay, but if not voluntarily, I have been trusted with management.
So what is the pay to me? That as I share good news, I might place the good news of the Anointed King without cost (for the "for my authority in the good news not to be overused" part).
You see, being free from all people, to all people I enslaved myself so that I might gain the majority of people.

And to the Jewish people, I became as a Jewish person so that I might gain Jewish people. To the people under the law, I became as a person under the law so that I might gain the people under the law.
To the criminals, I became as a criminal (not being a criminal to God, but a lawful obeyer to the Anointed King) so that I might gain criminals.
To the weak, I became as a weak person so that I might gain the weak. To all people, I have become all things so that by all means I might rescue some.
I do this because of the good news, so that I might become a sharer of it together with you.
Don't you all realize that all the people running in a lap (200 yards) race certainly run, but one takes the prize? This is how you all must run, so that you might completely take it.

Everyone struggling for a race restrains himself in everything. So those people certainly restrain themselves so that they might receive a deteriorating award wreath, but we, an undeteriorating award wreath.
Now then, this is how I run, not obscurely. This is how I box, not as if I am beating the air.
But I give my body a black eye and lead it as a slave, that somehow, after speaking publicly to others, I might not become unapproved myself.
